intro: Byttneria sagittifolia, commonly known as arrowleaf byttneria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Byttneria sagittifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
